frameDefinitions: This frame contains words which name permanent fixed structures forming an enclosure and providing protection from the elements.
The action of an Agent or the occurrence of a Cause event returns an Entity to an earlier  state of vigor and strength.

These words describe the recovery or healing of a Patient from an Affliction without reference to the influence of any Treatment or Healer (see the Cure frame).  '' 'My injuries had not yet completely healed.'
This frame describes assembly or construction actions, where an Agent joins Components together to form a Created_entity, which is profiled, and hence the object of the verb.
In this frame a Deformer deforms a Patient possibly against a Resistant_surface such that it undergoes a shape-change from its canonical or original shape into the Configuration, a new shape.
A group of Colonists from a Homeland migrate to and proceed to settle in a New_area.
frameExamples: The baroque <t>church</t>, built in 1635, has a very rich interior
Falling prices and wireless connectivity have <t>breathed new life</t> into the PDA market.
My injuries had not yet completely <t>healed</t>.
Jack <t>built</t> a new house out of bricks.
Ellen <t>crumpled</t> the paper into a ball.
In the 7th century BC, Phoenicians <t>colonized</t> the eastern section of Libya.
listRoleDefinitions: The entity built by the <fen>Builder</fen> which has some <fen>Function</fen>.
The building's location.
The concrete or abstract thing that is brought into an earlier state in which it was more effective and powerful.
The <fen>Agent</fen> puts the <fen>Entity</fen> into a state of renewed vigor.
An event or state whose occurrence brings about the <fen>Entity</fen>'s return to a vigorous state.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> causes the renewal of the <fen>Entity</fen>.
This role identifies the place where the Agent brings about the change in the <fen>Entity</fen>'s state.
The    Patient may either be expressed as the External Argument or, as in Health.Cure, may occur as the possessor of the Affliction (an example of role conflation):
This role is the injury, pain or disease experienced by the Patient.  Affliction occurs either as an External Argument of verbs or as a PP Complement of nouns or verbs:
Where Body Part is expressed as a separate constituent (rather than in phrases such as <ment>the wound on Pat's arm</ment>), it occurs as an External Argument:
The time at which the recovery takes place.
The location where the recovery takes place.
The <fen>Agent</fen> builds a <fen>Created_entity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Components</fen> that form the <fen>Created_entity</fen>.
<fen>Created_entity</fen> identifies the entity that is created in the act of building.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the building occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the building occurs.
The <fen>Deformer</fen> is the one who does the reshaping.
The <fen>Patient</fen> is the entity acted on and that undergoes a change.
The <fen>Cause</fen> is an animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that produces an effect. Volitionality is not a necessary characteristic of <fen>Cause</fen>s.
A state that holds of the <fen>Patient</fen> or a relation that holds among the constituent parts of the <fen>Patient</fen> as a result of the arranging action.
The role <fen>Time</fen> identifies when the <fen>Deformer</fen> intentionally affects the <fen>Patient</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> indicates where the <fen>Deformer</fen> intentionally affects the <fen>Patient</fen>.
A group of people who move together to an area outside their <fen>Homeland</fen> for the purpose of settling.
The <fen>Homeland</fen> is where the <fen>Colonists</fen> are originally from.
The <fen>Colonists</fen> move to the <fen>New_area</fen>, inhabiting it and (in the case of nation-states) extending the control of the <fen>Homeland</fen>.
The time at which the colonizing takes place.
listRoleExamples: The reinvigoration <fex>of the tourism</fex> economy is recognised by many as an ambitious but necessary objective.
<fex>We</fex> revitalized the Golden Mountaineer Card, and we gave seniors a prescription drug benefit.
Rock has been rejuvenated creatively and commercially <fex>by hip-hop-inspired rock acts</fex>.
Production was revitalized <fex>last June</fex>.

New York's distinction as America's tax cut leader has revitalized the economy
<fex>in every corner of the state</fex>.
<fex>Pat</fex> is convalescing from surgery.
<fex>The wound</fex> is healing well.
<fex>Pat's arm</fex> healed up quickly.
<fex>Jack</fex> built a new house.
Jack built  a new house <fex>out of old bricks</fex>.
Jack built <fex>a new house</fex>.
Jack built a new house <fex>early in the morning</fex>.
Jack built a new house <fex>in a glade</fex>.
<fex>The lieutenant</fex> crushed it angrily with his boot before looking back at Hencke.
Jack plucked the flower out of his morning coat and closed his fist slowly over it , crushing <fex>it</fex> into a pulp.
<fex>The strong winds</fex> deformed the structure of the outhouse.
The lieutenant crushed it angrily with his boot <fex>before looking back at Hencke</fex>.
<fex>Spain</fex> settled the northern areas of Mexico through the use of missions, civil settlements, and presidios.
Norse invaders in the 900s colonized <fex>the North Midlands</fex> more densely than any other part of England'
The English colonized the islands <fex>in 1632</fex>.
